name: Campsite
description: Campsite for caravans and tents to be pitched at far end of the paddock.

name: Duck Pond
description: Large pond by the main lawn where the ducks can be found.

name: Deer Park
description: Nature reserve home to Normanby Parks deer.

name: South Lodge
description: An open wildlife area at the bottom of the park.

name: Pet Cemetery
description: Historical resting place for The Sheffield families beloved pets.

name: Bandstand
description: Wooden bandstand with sheltered seating.

name: Go Ape
description: Go Ape activity area.

name: Go Ape Cabin
description: Point of call for Go Ape customers.

name: Photo Frame
description: Oversized photoframe for visitor photographs with The Hall as backdrop.

name: Model Railway
description: The model railway, running Sundays and bank holidays.

name: Anglers Lake
description: Fishing lake located in the Deer Park.

name: Woodland Path
description: There are several routes to walk through the woodland areas.

name: Crazy Golf
description: Crazy golf attraction open on weekends in season.

name: Normanby Park Golf Course
description: An 18 hole golf course.

name: Ice House
description: Ice chamber for built for Sir Robert Sheffield, 1987.

name: Bird Feeding Station
description: Wildlife watching area located in the woods.

name: Normanby Hall
description:
Opening Times: 10:00 - 16:00
March - October
A Regancy mansion open to visitors as a musuem.

name: Rural Life Museum
description:
Opening Times: 10:00 - 16:00
April - October
Museum of rural working and domestic lives in Lincolnshire.

name: The Stableyard Cafe
description:
Opening Times: 9:30 - 17:00
Selling hot meals, drinks and snacks.

name: Golf Clubhouse
description: Food and drink available to non Golf members, has toilet and shower facilities for the campsite.

name: The Giftshop
description:
Opening times: 10:00 - 17:00
Selling a variety of gifts and souvenirs.

name: The Kennels
description: The old kennel block is the main toilet site in the park.

name: The Stables
description: The old stables, opened up for museum displays.

name: The Coach House
description: Museum housing the Normanby Park fire engine.

name: Park Education Rooms
description: Classroom and function room for school visits and hire.

name: R-Evolution
description: R-Evolution office and classroom.

name: Normanby Arms
description: Outdoor bar located on the front lawn selling drinks and snacks.

name: Laundry Cottage
description: Normanby Park offices.

name: Pay Booth
description: Admission tickets, annual passes and general enquiries.

name: Changing Places
description: Special requirement toilet and shower facilities, access code required.

name: Toilet Cabin
description: Toilet facilities located on the front lawn.

name: Playhouse
description: Wooden playhouse with kitchen for children.

name: Story Telling Area
description: Seated woodland story telling area.

name: Large Play Area
description: Large astroturfed childrens playarea with zip wire.

name: Splashpad
description: Childrens splash zone playarea.

name: Wedding Gates
description: Old front gates into leading to the drive, opened for the bride on their wedding day.

name: Pedestrian Gate
description: Pedestration gate for local residents.

name: Deer Park Gates
description: Entrance and exit to the Deer Park, rear of The Hall.

name: Deer Park Kissing Gate
description: Entrance and exit to the Deer Park, by the Minitaure Railway

name: Main Gates
description: The main entrance to the park for vistors and staff.

name: Gwendelyn Drive Gate
description: Drive leading from the coach park to the lawn and wedding gates.

name: The Walled Garden
description:
Opening Times: 9:00 - 16:30
Victorian walled garden growing a variety of plants including fruits and vegetables.

name: The Sunken Garden
description: Sunken garden by The Hall with a pond and Birches.

name: The Wellbeing Garden
description: A peaceful garden of with plants selected that invoke sensory responses. Formally the Winter Garden

name: The Rose Garden
description: Garden located at the rear of The Hall

name: Hard Standing Car Park
description: The main car park for the site.

name: Coach Park
description: Coach and bus parking spaces.

name: Gardener's Museum
description: Recreations of the head gardener's office, potting shed, tool store and bothy at the Victorian Walled Garden

name: Deer Barn
description: The old deer barn, has no visitor access but can be viewed from the woodland path.

name: Paddock Car Park
description: Additional parking spaces.

name: Overspill Car Park
description: Additional parking spaces used on larger event days.
